Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Statue of a seated goddess
Description: Principal element of a composite statue of a seated goddess. Tenons were provided to attach the crown, uraeus, arms and legs (all of which have disappeared).  The figure is coiffed with a tripartite wig mounted by a kalathos decorated with erect cobras. There is also a large tenon to attach the statue to a separate pedestal.
